name: Musica Nova
tagline: Musica Nova - Classical Music
description: Musica Nova takes a journey of discovery through one thousand years of classical music history. Canadian composers are featured regularly along with occasional surprises of jazz and world music.

name: Northern Air
tagline: Northern Air showcases new folk and folk influenced music from all across Canada.
description: Northern Air features exclusively Canadian folk and folk influenced music released within the last year. Focused on sharing new interesting Canadian folk music and providing information on songs and artists. Special focus each show on local talent from CJSRs home of Alberta.

name: Hip Hop Buffet
tagline: Hip Hop Buffet - Your one stop shop for good hip hop.
hosts: Butter Chicken Wolf, Cartwright The Architect & DJ Double Booked
description: Playing hip hop music from the old school, new school and everything in between.

name: Twang n' Thangs
tagline: The best in independent Country/Roots/Folk and Old Timey Gems.
description: Twang n' Thangs is your weekly dose of old timey to classic to psychedelic country jams. New releases, local bands, interviews and special guests... if it's country-tinged you'll find it here! Amy and Thea comb the dusty stacks of vinyl and their favourite record stores for the best of the new and the old. WHY WOULDN'T WE?

name: Full English Breakfast
tagline: Eclectic music, current news and bikey chat.
hosts: Peter Chapman with CJSR's bicycle traffic reporter Karly Coleman
description: A lively blend of new music, quirky news and bicycle chat. On the last Thursday of the month, join us from 8am for an extended topic on Bike Bits.

name: Hip Hop Spread on Planet Bread
tagline: CJSR's only global hip hop music show, tracking the globalization of rap.
hosts: DJ Spooky Luke & Tam Tam the Destroyer
description: Hip Hop Spread on Plant Bread investigates the global spread of hip hop culture. Tracking the spread of hip hop worldwide from the 1980's until the most recent global rap.

name: Terra Informa
tagline: Terra Informa - Your source for environmental news.
description: Each week Terra Informa delivers coverage of breaking environmental news from across the country and around the world. From corporate wrongdoings to tips on living a little greener, we're your source for the news that the mainstream media missed.

name: Science For The People
tagline: Guiding you through the fascinating world of science and critical thinking.
description: Science For The People interviews the experts to help listeners understand the arguments and evidence behind what’s in the news and on the shelves, and delves into the slippery social issues to which one can apply science and critical thinking.

name: The Missing Link
tagline: Hip Hop they've been hiding from you and your loved ones.
description: Underground, independent and Canadian Hip Hop from the eighties until now.

name: Ranking B's Fortress of Solitude
tagline: Soul-centric Sounds from Then & Now
description: 1 hour of Soul, Funk, Afrobeat, R'n'B, Boogaloo, Pysch, & Neo-Soul.

name: The Toast Marketing Board / Señor Blues
tagline: Blues music programming
description: Two hours of nothin' but the blues! Tune in to hear blues classics, new releases, buried treasures, artist spotlights, and of course, live blues!

name: Field Tracker
tagline: Ambient music radio.
description: An all ambient radio show focusing on everything that is slow. Drone, electronic, and experimental music at the sleepiest time of the week.

name: Catch The Beat
tagline: Eclectic electronic dance music program.
description: Canada's longest running electronic music program showcasing the best in eclectic underground dance music from past, present and future.  First aired in September 1986 it has become a backbone to the underground dance music scene in Edmonton.

name: Gaywire
tagline: News, views and entertainment from Edmonton's Gay and Lesbian community.
description: Since the 1980s Gaywire has been Edmonton's source for queer news, politics, arts, culture, and beyond.

name: Local-Motive
tagline: Local-Motive - Eclectic programming to your local dial.
description: Local-Motive brings new music each week to your local dial.

name: Afro Caribbean Beats
tagline: Contemporary African and Caribbean music

name: Jazzology
tagline: Jazz show exploring new artists and old chestnuts.
description: A fantastic Jazz journey for those new to Jazz and passionate fans alike.

name: Soul of the City
tagline: Looking into the arts & culture that feed the soul of the city.

name: Voice of Eritrea
tagline: Offers news, community event announcements,  educational materials (on democracy, governance, …), cultural songs.

name: Necrotechs UNITE!
tagline: Necrotechs UNITE!: Industrial/Metal music on CJSR
description: Bringing together listeners of all dark natures! A mix of electronic-based and dark music, including industrial, electro-club, techno, heavy metal, nu metal, psychobilly and other fun tunes. It's all music I enjoy and want to share with the listeners!

name: Fourre-Tout
tagline: Fourre-Tout a French suitcase, a variety show in which all francophone can belong.
description: We are a magazine radio show that aims at informing, entertaining and uniting francophones while connecting with the various cultures that form our Francophone/Francophile Edmonton Community. The programming of Fourre-Tout is committed to reflect the particular characteristics of French cultural mosaic.

name: The Tiny Bubbles Radio Hour
tagline: Radio that will change your life. Missing it would be foolish.
description: Show tunes, old comedy records, rock 'n roll, pop, The Omnivore's Guide to the Arts w/ Lada, and the Gmail Agony Line.

name: Acimowin
tagline: 'IndiginiZing the Airwaves' with 'jo-jo on the Radioh', ACIMOWIN is Cree for let’s talk, let’s share, let’s tell stories and that is just what we do.
description: 'IndigeniZing the AirwaveZ' is a mixed media program of video and radio.  Which brings audiences behind the scene, up close and personal as host, Jo-Jo invites guests into a forum for discussion on indignity and current issues we face as indigenous people.  The show also highlights and celebrates our gifts and talents as indigenous artists, musicians, performers and entertainers.

name: Sounds Ukranian
tagline: Not your parents' Ukrainian music show.
description: Ukrainian music programming covering at least six centuries and even more genres, with new tunes every week.

name: 5 River Beat
tagline: 5 River Beat – CJSR’s Bhangra Specialist
description: Raw Punjabi Folk, Bhangra and Bollywood Funk Straight from the Motherland.
genre: Punjabi Folk, Bhangra and Bollywood Funk

name: The African Show
tagline: A pleasant journey to modern Africa
description: DJ Slice and DJ Starbax bring you news updates and the best modern up tempo beats from all across the African continent. The African Show also features news and interviews with members of the local African community in Edmonton. Keep current and tune in every Sunday at noon!

name: Agua Latina
tagline: Latin Music for dancing

name: Makin' Whoopee
description: Every Monday Chad & Colin get down to business, talking about sci-fi, comics, and whatever else they can manage at 7am.  Featuring your weekly update from the Asia League of Ice Hockey, TextBot Trivia, the Monday Morning Fortune Cookie and weather updates from the Long John Index!  Tune in or face destruction!

name: OPEN SLOT
tagline: Do what you want to

name: Democracy Now!
tagline: An independent global news hour
description: Democracy Now!’s War and Peace Report provides our audience with access to people and perspectives rarely heard in the U.S.corporate-sponsored media, including independent and international journalists, ordinary people from around the world who are directly affected by U.S. foreign policy, grassroots leaders and peace activists, artists, academics and independent analysts. In addition, Democracy Now! hosts real debates–debates between people who substantially disagree, such as between the White House or the Pentagon spokespeople on the one hand, and grassroots activists on the other.

name: Borrowed Tunes
tagline: Music from Edmonton’s Public Libraries
description: Modern popular music from the many different genres available from Edmonton’s Public Libraries as selected by your host, Joel Zimmerman.

name: The Erotic Dancer's Guide to Fine Music
tagline: Your weekly guide to progressive rock
description: The only progressive rock show on the prairies, hosted by prog rock artist Alan Burant. Love it or loathe it, there is no denying the influence of prog rock on current musical trends. Prog rock: the original underground alternative music!

name: Exit Music For Films
tagline: A cinematically-focused music show; showcasing music from, for and inspired by films.
description: Every week DJ Solar Priest brings you a showcase of eclectic music originally composed for or majorly inspired by films. Each show features film-oriented music in a variety of formats, including original film scores, selections from motion picture soundtracks, or even plain old covers or radical re-interpretations of music from the silver screen.
genre: Film Scores, Movie Soundtracks, Film Music Interpretations, etc.

name: OPEN SLOT
tagline: Do what you want to

name: Counterspin
tagline: A syndicated independent news show which examines the mainstream media.
description: CounterSpin is a weekly radio show, hosted by Janine Jackson, Steve Rendall and Peter Hart. CounterSpin is heard on more than 130 noncommercial stations across the United States and Canada. CounterSpin provides a critical examination of the major stories every week, and exposes what the mainstream media might have missed in their own coverage.

name: Interslice
tagline: Eclectic Electronic Music from the Fringe to the Familiar
description: Host DJ Aaron Slice explores genres and sub-genres of electronic-based music that he feels deserve more attention. Guests make regular appearances to discuss why electronic music appeals to them, who their influences are and what their writing/composition process involves. Occasional live performances in studio.

name: Trigger Cuts: CJSR's Top 30
description: Our friendly neighbourhood Music Director Chad takes you through a weekly spin of CJSR's most played records, in handy countdown form. Covering every genre, from experimental to indie to folk to metal to blues to whatever, Trigger Cuts is your crash course in eclectic. Follow along here!

name: The Organ Grinder
tagline: Music with a high-organic content.
description: Host Joe Hartfeil pulls out all the stops with a program specifically dedicated to music featuring the king of instruments, the organ in all its forms. Greasy, soul-stirring and always music with a high organic content. Wednesday afternoons from 1-2 pm.

name: Giant Lizards Shall Rule the Earth
Thee Ipso Factory / 20th Century Charles Dickens Experience
Rise Up
tagline: Spoken Word Radio from down below and to the left.
description: Edmonton’s only radical left news program, Rise Up! covers stories that the mainstream media can’t, or won’t touch about the most marginalized people and communities in our society today.

name: Soothe Electric
tagline: Far/Out and Plentiful.
description: Soothe Electric is a no hits radio program guaranteeing tracks of self-indulgent personal interest spanning the history of recorded sound and public performance.

name: 68 Comeback Special
tagline: Hook glut, pop exploits, agreeable tension, dissonance, hope for Mankind.
description: Tom and Craig are grizzled veterans of the radio wars, complete opposites in all ways except in their belief that Lou Reed's Metal Machine Music can be fit into any social occasion. Much of what they do is in preparation for Gabe (current Grade 7 correspondent) and Sadie (occasional impish interlocutor) to take over the running of the show. We've set this for some time around 2030.

name: Mocassin Telegraph
tagline: Edmonton's only Aboriginal Issues Call-In Show.
description: Moccasin Telegraph is call-in show focused on issues and events that affect aboriginal peoples across Canada and around the world.

name: Deco Kino Radio
tagline: Reminding the world that Edmonton is as weird and wonderful as anywhere else!
description: A weekly program specializing in lost gems, fun mis-shapes, and some of the best music Edmonton has to offer. Deco Kino Radio features local artists, live recordings, as well as other charming music and flights of fancy. Tune in every Thursday at 9:00pm. Check the website for podcasts!

name: Deprogram / Chaiwalla's Boom Box
tagline: An eclectic, electric mix of world, roots, roots rock, and reggae
description: Join CJSR's longest standing volunteer (since 1972, actually he has been sitting most of the time) Norm Frizzell as he presents music from all sorts of places, styles, and times.  Explore world music without losing your luggage.  Hear some new music from old favorites, old music from new favorites, or combinations there of.   Every second Thursday.

name: The CJSR Edition
tagline: A Radio Kaleidoscope!
description: Featuring stories about growth, decay, and transformation, The CJSR Edition is Edmonton's magazine for radio. It's a radio program that's a portal to other worlds and other perspectives.

name: Events Calendar
description: In the all mighty city of Edmonton there are loads of events to hit, but which ones are the best? I'll tell you! Tune in every Friday between 4-5pm where I serve up all the details of the coming week's best events.

name: Moving Radio / Groundwire
tagline: Edmonton's Radio Silver Screen / Community Radio News
description:
Moving Radio is your home to all the local, Canadian, and independent cinema that you can get your buttery fingers on. Join your host Christian Zyp every second Friday for irreverent interviews, film reviews, and anything else Edmonton silver screen related.

GroundWire is a 29-minute news radio program featuring headlines, reports and features from the community radio sector in Canada. The program aims to be a strong, reliable, high-quality newscast, engaging the audience with geographically and culturally diverse features that address issues of interest to specific communities as well as to a national audience.

GroundWire features stories that are local, regional and national in scope and that share an ethic of human rights activism, equity, labour rights, democractic communication and information exchange, and progressive political and social policy.

name: Adamant Eve
tagline: Edmonton's only feminist news radio show!
description: We´re going there…for you! Seeing as women’s issues are as powerful as ever in this day and age, and if anything they’re much more complex, Adamant Eve is everything women have raved, wondered or smoldered about, along with a dose of news with a feminist bent and music to help you get your feminism on! Kapow!

name: Altered States
tagline: Roots of Heavy Metal: Psychedelic, Prog-Rock, Blues Rock, etc.
genre: Roots of Heavy Metal: Psychedelic, Prog-Rock, Blues Rock, etc.

name: Alternative Radio
tagline: Audio Energy for Democracy
description: Alternative Radio, established in 1986, is a syndicated weekly one-hour public affairs program offered free to all public radio stations in the US, Canada, Europe and beyond. AR provides information, analyses and views that are frequently ignored or distorted in other media.

name: BPM
tagline: The sounds of the global dance floor
description: The latest in electronic dance music from around the world, presented live in the mix by David Stone and guests, every Saturday.
